The pythonBeagle module¶

This module contains contains all required dependencies to run the Python project and serves three purposes. The first is to establish communication with the BBB via the TCP/IP protocol. The second is to simulate actuators in discrete time and the third is to allow actuator and sensory objects to manipulate and measure processes in real-time from the BBB.

class pythonBeagle.Actuator(pins=None, param=None, isSimulating=True)¶

The actuator class provides an interface required to run any actuator, such as a DC or stepper motor.

Parameters:
  • pins (list) – A list of pins on which the motor is run
  • isSimulating (bool) – A flag set to true if the actutator should be simulated
discretize_dynamics(A, B, G, h)¶

Discretizes a continuous time LTI system dot{x} = Ax + Bu + G using an exponential matrix formulation and zero-order hold

Parameters:
  • A (numpy.array) – System matrix shape (M,M)
  • B (numpy.array) – Control matrix shape (M,N)
  • G (numpy.array) – Constant matrix shape (M,1)
  • h (float) – Timestep in seconds
class pythonBeagle.DCmotor(pin=None, param=None, isSimulating=True, timestep=None)¶

The DC motor object enables simulation of and real-time interface to a brushless DC motor

class pythonBeagle.ReceiverThread(client=None, address=None, protocol='TCP', size=1024, verbose=False)¶

Receiver daemon which receives data on a socket.

Parameters:
  • address ((ip[str], port[int])) – An adress which needs to be specified in thent of UDP
  • client (socket.socket()) – An client which needs to be specified in thent of TCP
  • protocol (string) – A string tag set to TCP or UDP
get_data()¶

Get data from the receiver, set to None if no data has been received

Parameters:protocol – A data valued string
run()¶

Main loop of the thread

terminate()¶

Kills the thread instantaneously

class pythonBeagle.SenderThread(client=None, address=None, protocol='TCP')¶

Sender daemon which publishes data to a socket.

Parameters:
  • address ((ip[str], port[int])) – An adress which needs to be specified in thent of UDP
  • client (socket.socket()) – An client which needs to be specified in thent of TCP
  • protocol (string) – A string tag set to TCP or UDP
run()¶

Main loop of the thread

send_data(data)¶

Send data to the receiver

Parameters:protocol – A data valued string
terminate()¶

Kills the thread instantaneously

class pythonBeagle.ServerThread(clientReceiver, clientSender, size=1024)¶

Create a server daemon which handles communication between receiver and sender clients implementing TCP/IP.

Parameters:
  • cientReceiver (socket.socket()) – A client which is to receive data
  • cientSender (socket.socket()) – A client from which data is sent
  • size (int) – The buffer size
run()¶

Main loop of the thread

pythonBeagle.encode_array_to_hex(array)¶

Data is received as a numpy array with type dfloat64 in the the IEEE 745 standardand and is encoded to a string with a minimal hexadecimal representation.

Parameters:array (numpy.array) – Of shape (N,1) for some integer N>0
pythonBeagle.encode_hex_to_array(string)¶

Data is received as N float 64 entries by the 745 standard, coded in a minimal hexadecimal representation and converted into a numpy array of length (N,1).

Parameters:string (string) – A hexadecimal string with no separators
